name: Invoice Processing: Email to PostgreSQL Database with GPT-4o & Discord Alerts

description:
# AI-Powered Invoice Processing: from Email to Database & Chat Notifications

Automatically process PDF invoices directly from your email inbox. This workflow uses AI to extract key data, saves it to a PostgreSQL database, and instantly notifies you about the new document in your preferred chat application.

The workflow listens for new emails, fetches PDF attachments, and then passes their content to a Large Language Model (LLM) for intelligent recognition and data extraction. Finally, the information is securely archived in the database, and a summary of the invoice is sent as a notification.

> **üìù This workflow is highly customizable.**  
> It uses PostgreSQL, OpenAI (GPT), and Discord by default, but you can easily swap these components.  
> Feel free to use a different database like MySQL or Airtable, another AI model provider, or send notifications to Slack, MS Teams, or any other chat platform.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Note:** If the workflow fails to extract data correctly from invoices issued by certain companies, you may need to adjust the prompt used in the **Basic LLM Chain** node to improve parsing accuracy.

---

## Use Case

- Automating accounts payable for small businesses and freelancers  
- Centralizing financial documents without manual data entry  
- Creating a searchable database of all incoming invoices  
- Receiving real-time notifications for new financial commitments  

---

## Features

- **üìß Email Trigger (IMAP):** Monitors a dedicated email inbox for new messages with attachments  
- **üìÑ PDF Filtering:** Automatically identifies and processes only PDF attachments  
- **ü§ñ AI-Powered Data Extraction:** Uses an LLM (e.g., GPT-4o-mini) to extract invoice number, buyer/seller details, amounts, currency, and due dates  
- **‚öôÔ∏è Structured Data Output:** Converts AI output to standardized JSON  
- **üîç Database Write Logic:** Prevents duplicates by checking invoice/company combo  
- **üóÑÔ∏è PostgreSQL Integration:** Stores extracted data into `company` and `invoice` tables  
- **üí¨ Chat Notifications:** Sends invoice summary as message to a designated channel  

---

## Setup Instructions

### ‚ö†Ô∏è API Access & Costs

To use the AI extraction feature, you need an API key from a provider like OpenAI.  
Most providers charge for access to language models. You'll likely need a billing account.

---

### 1. PostgreSQL Database Configuration

Ensure your database has the following tables:

```sql
-- Table for companies (invoice issuers)
CREATE TABLE company (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    tax_number VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    address TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Table for invoices
CREATE TABLE invoice (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    company_id INTEGER REFERENCES company(id),
    invoice_number VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    -- Add other fields: total_to_pay, currency, due_date
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(company_id, invoice_number)
);


```


### Then, in n8n, create a credential for your PostgreSQL DB.

---

### 2. Email (IMAP) Configuration

In **n8n**, add credentials for the email account that receives invoices:

- IMAP host  
- IMAP port  
- Username  
- Password  

---

### 3. AI Provider Configuration

- Log in to OpenAI (or similar provider)  
- Generate API key  
- In **n8n**, create credentials and paste the key  

---

### 4. Chat Notification (Discord)

- Go to **Discord > Server Settings > Integrations > Webhooks > New Webhook**  
- Select channel  
- Copy Webhook URL  
- In **n8n**, paste URL into the Discord node  

---

### Placeholders and Fields to Fill

| Placeholder                | Description                               | Example                                  |
|---------------------------|-------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| `YOUR_EMAIL_CREDENTIALS`  | Your IMAP email account in n8n            | My Invoice Mailbox                       |
| `YOUR_OPENAI_CREDENTIALS` | API credentials for AI model              | My OpenAI Key                            |
| `YOUR_POSTGRES_CREDENTIALS`| Your PostgreSQL DB credentials in n8n    | My Production DB                         |
| `YOUR_DISCORD_WEBHOOK`    | Webhook URL for your chat system          | https://discord.com/api/webhooks/...     |

---

### Testing the Workflow

1. **Send a test invoice** to the inbox as a PDF attachment  
2. **Run the workflow** manually in **n8n** and check if the IMAP node fetches the message  
3. **Verify AI Extraction** ‚Äì inspect the LLM output (e.g., GPT node) and confirm structured JSON  
4. **Check the DB** ‚Äì ensure new rows appear in `company` and `invoice`  
5. **Check the chat** ‚Äì verify the invoice summary appears in the chosen channel  

---

### Customization Tips

- **Change the DB:** Use MySQL, Airtable, or Google Sheets instead of PostgreSQL  
- **Other notifications:** Swap Discord for Slack, MS Teams, Telegram, etc.  
- **Expand AI logic:** Extract line items, prices, etc. by customizing the prompt  
- **Add payment logic:** Allow marking invoices as paid via emoji or a separate webhook

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.text: Determine whether the provided text is an invoice. If it is, extract the following details: the invoice number, the items listed on the invoice along with their prices, the recipient and the issuer, the payment due date in the format dd-MM-yyyy, bank account details, the total net and gross amounts, the total amount to pay, and the currency of the invoice

parameters.query: =SELECT id FROM invoice WHERE invoice_number = '{{ $json.invoiceDetails.invoiceNumber }}' AND company_id = {{ $json.company_id }};

parameters.content:
### üì• Email Trigger (IMAP)

This node listens for new emails in your inbox and fetches PDF attachments.

**Setup Instructions:**
- Go to **Credentials** and create new IMAP credentials  
- Fill in: IMAP host, port, email address, and password  
- Optionally filter emails (e.g. only those with PDF attachments)

### ü§ñ AI Data Extraction (Basic LLM Chain)

This node sends the text from the PDF to an AI model (e.g. GPT-4o) to extract structured invoice data.

**Setup Instructions:**
- Provide a clear prompt describing which data to extract  
- Example: invoice number, dates, seller, buyer, tax number, total, currency  
- Use JSON as the expected response format

**Note:** 
If the model fails to read some invoices (e.g. unusual layout, languages, or formats), try improving or customizing the prompt.

### üîë OpenAI API (LLM Provider)

This node connects to OpenAI (or another AI provider) and sends the invoice content for analysis.

**Setup Instructions:**
- Log in to [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com) or your provider  
- Generate an API key  
- In **n8n**, create new credentials for the OpenAI node  
- Select the correct model (`gpt-4o`, `gpt-3.5-turbo`, etc.)

**Tip:** You can replace OpenAI with Anthropic, Mistral, or any compatible LLM node.

### üì§ Chat Notification (Discord Webhook)

This node sends a summary of the extracted invoice to your Discord channel.

**Setup Instructions:**
- In Discord:  
  Go to Server Settings ‚Üí Integrations ‚Üí Webhooks ‚Üí Create Webhook  
- Choose the target channel and copy the webhook URL  
- Paste the URL into this node in n8n

**Alternative:** 
Swap with Slack, Telegram, MS Teams, or another notification service.

### ‚ùó Don't forget to set your PostgreSQL credentials

In every PostgreSQL-related node, you must manually select your own credentials from the dropdown.

**Instructions:**
- Click on the node  
- Go to the **"Credentials"** section  
- Select your custom PostgreSQL connection (e.g. `My Production DB`)  
- Make sure the credentials have access to the correct database and tables

‚ö†Ô∏è The workflow will fail if no credentials are selected or if the connection is invalid.

### üîÄ Merge Node

This node merges metadata from the email (e.g., subject, sender) with the AI-extracted invoice content.

**Setup Instructions:**
- Input 1 ‚Üí AI output  
- Input 2 ‚Üí Email data  
- Set **Merge Strategy** to ‚ÄúMerge By Index‚Äù (if both inputs are aligned)

**Use case:** 
Attach additional metadata (e.g., sender email) to your final record or notification.

### üóÉÔ∏è PostgreSQL Insert

This node writes the extracted data into the `company` and `invoice` tables in your PostgreSQL database.

**Setup Instructions:**
- Ensure your database has the correct schema (see SQL setup)  
- Create credentials in **n8n** for your database  
- Map each extracted field to the corresponding column  
- Use ‚ÄúInsert‚Äù or ‚ÄúInsert & Update‚Äù depending on your logic

**Alternative:** 
You can replace this with MySQL, Airtable, Supabase, or Google Sheets.
